intro: Coelogyne fuscescens var. integrilabia, commonly known as the dark-labellum coelogyne, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces striking, fragrant flowers with yellow petals and a dark red lip. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte on trees, thriving in humid, shaded environments. It blooms during the winter months, adding a unique ornamental value to gardens and collections. Its botanical significance lies in its distinct morphology and ecological adaptations.
